Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use with a short learning curve. Compact, easy to switch modes.
Cons: Very Slow in low light situations.
This camera is simple to use and covers most basic photography needs as well as some some cool toys. You can shoot some great stuff right out of the box. The panorama mode is fun to play with. The SP mode settings are quick and easy to use for the quick shot. There is plenty of flexibility in other modes for the photo guru. Very fast boot time.. It takes pretty good video.
Problems- Frustratingly slow shutter speeds in low light conditions. The zoom is very noisy when shooting video. It goes through batteries pretty quickly if you shoot video. However, if you really want ot shoot video, you should probably get a dedicated video device.
Wish it h ... ad - RAW image capability. Smoother digital zoom
In General- I got this camera to replace an older fuji s series camera that has been a workhorse for me. I use it primarily for vacations and trips to theme parks and zoos with my family. I think this camera is the best product for the cost. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: You get a lot of bang for your buck.
Item.Review: I needed a good camera with a fair amount of options for use in a digital photography class, and boy does this deliver with out breaking the bank. As a college student with no excess of money to spend (though really, who does in the current climate)I was quite excited to find a bridge camera for under the average price tag of $200. I was a bit skeptical despite the product's reviews, and was ultimately worried I'd just end up with a pricey point-and-shoot. I was happily surprised after my first use of the camera once it arrived. There are enough manual settings that I can comfortably know that I'll be able to shoot any where regardless of the weather or lighting conditions. On the same token, the various scene settings and automatic controls means that I am able to quickly take a few photo ... s with out fumbling around for the correct ISO setting. While the camera itself really does need a separate bag to be carried in, it is not so large or cumbersome that one absolutely needs a camera bag for it. I myself just use an old small handbag with a towel for padding; the camera is durable enough that this has been sufficient. The body of the camera itself feels a bit out of place with the rest of the components, like it was taken off of a cheaper model, but the feel of the material doesn't necessarily indicate its quality. In fact, the camera itself is very light to use, which is useful when one plans on taking a lot of pictures. So far as the software goes, things are fairly intuitive once you've familiarized yourself with it; which the user manual makes quite easy. There can also sometimes be a bit of a shutter delay, but its when you would expect there to be one (such as when its manually set that way, or in a very low light situation.) All in all, I can foresee using this handy camera fora very long time, and would definitely look it up again should I never need another camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Cons: Bad in low light, grainy photographs
I got this after one that I had was not able to be fixed. I took it to the Bahamas and had mulitple problems. Any indoor pictures are almost always grainy (ISO is 400 or 800), and the outdoors ones were too bright. The flash isn't automatic and is a pain to use. It has a lot of features and a great lens, but it's not that helpful when it has trouble focusing in decent light. It's slow and I intend to be making a few calls to try to get my money back. I'm a semi-professional photographer, and grabbed this on the fly because I didn't want to take an expensive camera on vacation. I've had better results with an $80 simple point-and-shoot.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera has many features to be expected from more expensive SLRs. It can be used as point-and-shoot or in one of many different user-selected modes. The digital viewfinder is very useful as it avoids the difficulty in viewing the screen often experienced in bright light and also helps conserve battery power. Battery life is far better than my compact camera, though it does use four batteries rather than the two found in the compact. Picture quality is first-class and the zoom facility gives clear, crisp images. The main user manual on the CDrom supplied gives much greater detail about the available options than the quick-start guide. I have printed the full manual and used it frequently whilst exploring the camera's features. I am delighted with the quality of both the camera and the ... images it produces. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Cons: not so great in VERY low light but that is to be expected in auto modes.
I had an S100Fd. I bought it because I tried the super macro in the store and was totally blown away! One of my sons who is into photography took it from my dresser and dropped it and broke the battery door, so I bought this S9250 to replace it. Man, I am glad I did! AWESOME in the fine large picture modes, and all modes really. Still has (happy to report) the BEST macro in history, can focus down to mere inches away clearly! I always take great super macro photos with it. I LOVE the longer optical zoom! Great for point and shoot and even pro level (in a pinch) photos of further objects. I have a pro Canon DSLR and lenses and this littler Fuji is a GREAT compliment to t ... hat plus great for vacations and just carry with me stuff. I only shot a tad of footage in the HD 720p mode but it looks very smooth on the camera. I really need to shoot some clips and upload them and see what they really look like. So far it is even better than I expected. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Short Lag Time; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD
It's pretty good. There is an issue with the images at times, but it is not a serious one--just with the zoom. At 18x, the picture sometimes isn't as clear as others with less zoom even though it shows up clear in the LCD, but otherwise it is a really great camera. It doesn't happen frequently happen, I'd say it happens in 1/200 shots. Everything else is as mentioned, panorama shots are good, it eliminates shakiness for those of us who don't have steady hands, and has a lot of options for optimal camera use. I don't think that the lenses are interchangeable, so that might be a negative to those who want that option.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: AA Batteries, Price, 14 MPix, 18 X Optical Zoom
Cons: Digital Zoom,
This is a well rounded camera. Good set of features, easy to operate, AA batteries as a power source, easy to find everywhere. SD class 4 or more recommended by manufacturer. Me personal I prefer Class 6 as minimum on any camera or for the best results a Class 10. Camera materials are good quality as well its built quality. feels durable. Zoom of this camera is what your are paying for 18 X Optical and a 14 Megapixel camera for under $ 200.00 you can't beat that. Image stabilization is good, not to fast not to slow just right for the inexperience user. Low light Pics. are average for a camera this kind . Digital Zoom is not on by default but I see why it's does not work. If you decide to use the digital ... zoom on this camera you are not going to like it. Just used Optical Zoom with the quality of the Fuji lenses in it and you be pleased. Overall is a great buy for every family or person that needs a easy to use camera at a great price. Also you might what to get a set of rechargeable batteries, or go with lithium will last longer @ 500 pics. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this camera on special offer in january. i decided to give it a good try out before writing a review. i have taken over 500 photos up to now and find the battery life very good if using good quality rechargables.the picture quality is good as are colour reproductions. as of other reviews i have read, yes picture quality can look grainy on the screen also on the computor monitor when downloaded, though on the many photos i have so far printed they have all come out clear. the problem many seem to have regarding the lens cap if you use the small strap which came with the camera you won't lose it. in its self it is a very simple camera to use. the only question i would ask regards the photo of the full moon which the presenter said he had taken with it. i have tried every setting ... possible including the one he said he used, and cannot get anything like the quality he showed even with a tripod. apart from that for the price i find it good value. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Its a shame but there are better cameras out there
Item.Review: I would have to agree with a previous reviewer, this camera is not great. I currently have a point/shot and a full bridge camera and I thought that having seen the on screen demonstrations that this was the budget type middle road bridge camera that I was looking for. Not so. Basicity in bright light there is no problem. Indoor and dull conditions leave pictures very grainy. You need third party software to improve the photos. I did like the auto Macro feature but the Panoramic 3 auto shot feature was disappointing to say the very least. It takes this in 3mp only and in a 4:3 view format. This is not adjustable. Imagine a 3mp photo on an A4 sheet! Listen my mobile fone takes better quality pics then that. The hard plastic loose lens cap is rubbish. Push on job with no clip to hold in place ... . Cheap immediately came to mind. However overall its a good camera with lots of buttons and very easy to use. If you want small pictures and are not that particular, prefer to shot in bright conditions on a camera that only shots in the huge lossless .JPG format, then this camera is for you, otherwise its found wanting. Like others I wanted to love this camera but in the end my much cheaper Lumax point/shot camera does much more with better results. My recommendation would be that there are other cameras out there which are much less expensive and do a lot more. All IMHO of coarse expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Terrible in low light, zoom, and macro
Item.Review:
Pros: looks
Cons: zoom, macro, low light
This camera is no good. I bought it online during a Black Friday Sale, and was very disapointed. My 2 main uses are for live music (low light) and jewelry photos (macro mode) The finepix camera had great reviews for low light, and was on several lists for best concert/lowlight camera. NOT TRUE! It performed horrbly as a concert camera. I tried shooting in several modes and 95% of the shots were blurred. The rest were very grainy. Also the zoom is no good! In any lighting the zoom produced about 80% blurred photos. The macro mode also is no good! Blurry even when using the flash.
I took the camera back and was looking to exchang it for another camera. From reading online reviews I was deciding between a canon po ... wershot and the nikon coolpix. When I went into the store I shot some test shots to compare. I took a picture of my ring on my hand close up to test the macro mode. In addition, I shot it under the shelf to block out the bright store lights. Both of these cameras blew the Fuji away in low light performance, and macro node.
Of the two cameras tested at the store there was one clear winner, and that was the Nikon coolpix. I have been using it for a couple of days, and couldn't be happier. I wish I would have tested the cameras before using site to store to purchase the fuji camera.
Also the batteries fly out every time you open the compartment to remove the memory card. This camera looks cool, but does not perform well in zoom, low light, and macro. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Small / Compact; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Large Clear LCD
I wanted to get a camera for my girl friend's daughter. She had asked about an SLR but those were a lot more than I wanted to spend. I found this at a low, reasonable and affordable price so I jumped on it. I will deliver it in a couple of weeks and see how she reacts to it then. I've already shot a few photos with it to see how it operates and make sure everything works okay. I'm giving it to a girl in China so a return would be difficult to deal with. The camera is fairly intuitive. I didn't want to open the instruction book that comes with it and I was able to take several shots, manipulate them and erase them ... all. The camera also has several languages built into it for ease of use. Chinese is one of them. I didn't know this when I bought it but discovered it when I was exploring. The daughter teaches English so that wouldn't have been a problem anyway but it is a nice feature. I used the Zoom and I like its performance as well but I am not a professional so I am not terribly demanding. One thing I didn't realize when I bought it is that it doesn't have any memory built into it. I didn't buy a memory card at the time I purchased the camera but I did go back to buydig and get an 8 gig card for a very low price. I am pleased with this purchase, I recommend both this camera and buydig...two thumbs up! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
We bought this as a TSV as a replacement for a Canon bridge camera bought from QVC several years ago. Our initial impression was that it was a bit disappointing - the build quality is not up to Canon standards, the lens cap is flimsy and ergonomically it's not as good to hold, as held in the right hand. the thumb lies on the screen, rather than beside it (and my wife does not have big hands).
The quality of the photos did seem good though, certainly beating the 8 megapixel Canon. We took it to the local Wildfowl and Wetlands Trust centre and gave it a good test. Although the 3 inch screen can be used for basic review, don't use it as a judge of absolute sharpness, it needs to be viewed on a big screen and at 200% or more. The quality was certainly morel than acceptable.
My wi ... fe particularly liked the Panaromic Movie mode, to create panaromic photos in camera and without a tripod - they really do come out well and can be viewed as a 'movie' (well a horizontal scroll) on the Computer monitor.
Video quality is fine in terms of the visual experience, producing broadcast quality video. The audio though is not up to the same standard, as one of the other reviewers has stated. This is a problem for all cameras with a built in microphone, though this seemed worse than others I've heard. If you are going to add your own soundtrack later then it's OK but it's not something to shoot your oscar winning movie on.
The accompanying software is also not really up to standard. It claims to allow direct upload to Facebook and You Tube. Whilst the latter does work, uploading to Facebook does not. Checking the internet, this seems to be a result of one of Facebooks fairly recent changes. Using Facebook's own uploader still gets them there though.
Unless you are taking portrait photos, switch of warnings for blinking, face recognition, and red eye reduction, all of which slow down the camera's readiness for the next photo.
Lastly, we don't like the now common practice of putting t ... expand » « collapse

I am really enjoying this camera. Easy to use and great size that is comfortable in hand. The pictures are great. Still working on all the features but those that I have used are great.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I had a Fuji Finepix from before that I had purchased and loved it until the camera automatic shutter got jammed. I am pretty sure that was my fault... but have loved the model so much that I had to get the new one when I found it... The value is awesome compared to some of the other models out there, and for the most part it is click and shoot. Sometimes you have to be really still for the photos to come out right, but it definely is a HUGE upgrade from the 4 megapixels I had before! :)

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: just could not get to satisfied
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Nice Body Color; Decent price for features; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay; Poor Image Quality; Photos not clear
camera was easy to set up (batteries sd card). began taking indoor pictures and noticed that some pictures were not clear. took time to take it outside , low light , and used different settings available and could not get to a point where i could say yea i want this.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I love this camera! I've had it for 5 months now and has given me no problem. I've gone through a lot of cameras and finally found a great one. You just have to be patient to capture a good picture or else it comes out blurry. A great feature: it doesn't consume the batteries like other HD cameras.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price and performance
Cons: You need to buy separate recharagable battaries!
This product has plenty of features. It is good under low light but you need a very stable hand to make it work under low light. In normal light conditions this product performs fantastic. Zoom is excellent. I prefer the custom setting which allows excellent quality pictures in low light conditions. Panorama feature is very useful when you are out on trips taking pictures of scenaries. It is very easy to use.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Great Zoom
Cons: No Viewfinder
Bought this for my wife. The size is good and controls easy to use. She is a beginner and now enjoys taking family and travel photos

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Wide angle view; Has a viewfinder; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality; Great Zoom; Uses AA batteries; Easy To Use; Nice Body Color
Neat panoramic mode.Love it. Wide angle is great for indoor photos. Most changes can be made quickly by reading the screen tips - such as press the +/- button and use the arrow keys.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm newly interested in photography and the FinePix S2950 14MP Digital Camera by Fujifilm fits my novice hand like a glove (or eye like a viewfinder?). I love the balance the FinePix offers--simplicty in design but capable of capturing terrific images. I definitely chose the right camera to start with, it virtually teaches you how to use it all on its own. Can't wait to get out there more often with my FujiFilm!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Great value for money some fantastic settings!
Captured some brilliant 'in action' shots! Definitely read the manual to get the most out of it!
Couldn't recommend it more!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact
Cons: User manual on cd
Bought this camera for my wife's birthday. She had an older Canon that was not working well and this camera was a big hit. Easy for her to use and easy to transfer pictures to her computer. High quality camera at a good price.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: After many years of digital cameras I wanted to move up the ladder. DSLR was to big and to expensive so I decide to look for a decent bridge camera. I have used Fuji's for years and touch wood never had a problem. On a recent trip to Majorca we visited a Dolphin park and missed heaps of great pics due to slow camera reaction. Last weekend we visited a horse show and the camera performed superbly. The camera is light and easy to use, but play about with it first and read the instructions thoroughly. Well worth the money.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use
Cons: It's a bit bulky and hard to hold on to, Strap comes loose from tim to time
The camera takes awesome pictures right out of the box. the only thing is the strap comesoff easily! It's great for point and shoot, and for manual setting if you know how to do that kind of stuff! I love the quality of pictures that this camera produces!!!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera at an Affordable Price
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight and Functionality
Cons: Haven't had it long enough....
I received this Camera when best buy fouled up my order. It wasn't the camera I purchased, but Best buy matched the price and I got this one. It has all the features, just lesser mega pixels. So far so good... I can zoom in on my son at the playground and get all the good pictures from a distance. I don't have to be right in his face anymore lol. If he's moving the camera auto adjusts and get's me the best picture. The Micro function is great for photographing flowers and the fruits in my garden. I Love this camera... I had a Fujifilm before, so I trusted the name. That camera is still working and I've had it since 5 mega pixel's was good...

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It's my multi-use camera, it's great for any situation. You can even 'play' with some features and take great photos. The slow shutter speed allows you to catch lots of light without increasing ISO.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use , Great pictures
Cons: Nothing so far
Got this camera for fathers day. Right out of the box i was taking great pictures. Camera is so easy to use. Pictures are great in anykind of light. Has a ton of features. The feel of the camera and the quality are excellent. The zoom feature works great, as does the flash. You will love this camera for all pictures.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Although I did a lot of on-line research before purchasing this camera, I still didn't get exactly what I was looking for. I wanted a bridge between a point and shoot and an SLR, a camera that I could manually focus, but also worked as an auto focus. This camera won't let you manually focus, but that said, it does work beautifully as a point and shoot. I read that it allowed manual focus on another website, and I already had a small point and shoot that works fine, so I wouldn't have purchased this if I didn't think it would allow the manual focus feature. But, I got such a great deal on it through Club O that I'm keeping it! ...

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this mostly for nature and function shots. I love my older fujifilm s9000, but needed an upgrade. This one seems great... but I do sense some lag time inbetween shots. Perhaps with more use, it is something I can get used too... have not used it for continuous shooting yet and that is why I wanted this newer camera. Styling is great, nice and light in the hands, panoramic is great... have yet to use it for portrait shots... but will keep you posted.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: have taken a lot of pictures both inside and outdoors and the quality of the prints have been very good.very impressed with the optical zoom .as a novice i always leave the setting on auto scene and am very happy with the results. have not used the video function yet as the only reason i purchased the camera was for photos. would recommend

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
This was a present for my husband who wanted an upgrade from a 6 megapixels compact to a bridge camera & this fitted the bill.
With regret the camera is being returned as it does have an operating problem that the predecessors to this model show and has not yet been solved by Fuji. The optical zoom on movie de-focuses the image when zooming and then struggles to regain focus for a second or two even in good outdoor light. The digital zoom works reasonably well on movie but is only x3.
Otherwise as a still camera it is very good and as a movie camera without zooming the HD is good. We agree with other reviewers’ comments about the microphone pick up on movie mode but could forgive this if the optical zoom feature worked properly.
It is a pity as all the still camera ... s that we have had for over 10 years are Fuji and we have always been very satisfied with them, good quality, all work well and when one did have a problem it was fixed by Fuji under guarantee very quickly.
The battery charger included has developed a fault with only one of the led charge indicators working, but this is not a design fault but we guess a random breakdown. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am unhappy with this camera. Pictures are too dark and grainy. Using the flash washes everything out. Colours are not natural looking at all, yellows in particular are very glary and over bright. Brown and white or creamy shades have a yellow tinge to them. My tabby cat hasn't got a yellow-ish head. Yes, the camera is fairly easy to use, with a good zoom and once you turned off the annoying bleeps from the focus & shutter, taking pictures of pets was easy and they didn't jump every time you tried to focus on them. However the colours just didn't look right. I would have expected digital cameras to have improved a lot in the last 8 years or so. My old point and shoot digital camera takes much more lifelike and natural looking pictures. Sorry Fuji, this just isn't up to scratc ... h so it has been returned to QVC. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have returned this camera which I had ordered for my husband (who is very disappointed having to send it back). I bought the Fuji S1600 previously from QVC and am delighted with its performance. Unfortunately the S2950 did not live up to expectations. The photos are grainy and the video seems to fluctuate between a fairly clear picture and being out of focus. The paper manual is very brief and not very helpful unlike the manual for the S1600.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Did not work on arrival. Per instructions packaged with the item, I called Fuji and they said to send to them, which I did that day.
6-16-12 received carbon print out from Fuji that they had received it.
No word since.
I am down 159.00 plus 10.00 to return it to Fuji.
At this point I am upset with Buydig for sending me a non functioning camera and Fuji.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great first camera for the enthusiast!
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Good Image Stabilization; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Easy To Use; Great Zoom; Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light
I have wanted a camera for a long time, and I waited to purchase. The Fujifilm Fine Pix S2950 is perfect to take on my vacation this year. I also use it to photograph tropical vegetation in development and birds that stop by to visit. After downloading the entire user manual and reading it carefully, I have had great ease of use. I have used the Kodak Zi8 for video, but it looks like the Fujifilm Fine Pix can do both video and stills.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It is awful camera. It seems like it is professional but it is light and really useless... The cover of the lens is loose. Settings are limited The quality of a phone camera is a way better than this one.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: i already have and will continue to recommend this camera. i was looking for an upgrade from my old sony 8mp camera. i read the reviews on this one, alot good and a few bad. i haven't had any of the bad issues with mine. it takes great pics, zoom is awesome and it came with an 8gb sd card and case and was still cheaper than [@] from B&H photo. i highly recommend this camera for the average user who wants to creat great home photos and to experiment with even more with becoming a great photographer.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: the best camera ever for this price
Item.Review: i went to Washington alone for trip and i took amazing pictures,the camera it's like my friend. the zoom is enough . the big problem is 4 batteries to use in camera.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: They had an 8 hour sale and sold this for $18.99
Item.Review:
Pros: Fantastic optical zoom, and the flash is the best I've used.
Cons: Takes AA batteries instead of a rechargeable pack. Oh well..
I was planning on buying this camera, then they knocked the price down below $20, and I jumped on it. Great camera, ESPECIALLY for the price.
P.S. Don't count on them lowering the price like that again, I'm pretty sure it was a glitch. But the camera is totally worth $150 anyway.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Don't be fooled by the name.
Item.Review: This camera is a gift for my granddaughter who has a genuine interest in photography. This is her 3rd camera and her first with true flexibility. No more point and shoot. With this she can learn a great deal about how the photographer can create rather than simply capture great shots.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Great Zoom; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use
perfect camera for a novice photographer who wants professional results. easy to handle and all options are explained in camera menu. stupidproof! just what i like...would recommend to all.....

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use
Cons: Zoom range
This is my first try at cameras and so far so good. Easy to use, Easy to upload photos and Nice pictures. I would only wish for better zoom, but for the money its a good first shot.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I gave my wife this camera for Christmas as her old one quit. This camera is by far MUCH better quality than her old one, has more features and has a lower price. The camera is lightweight and if you get a good SD memory card (I got her a 16GB card), you can always be able to save your memories in high quality photos (panorama shots, too) or in HD video with sound without fumbling around with lenses.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
This is a very nice camera with some very good features some of which are not found in more expensive cameras.
An example of this is the stiching option. Take a couple of shots of a landscape and the camera stitches them together to make a panaramic shot. Very good

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: As a beginner the reviews i read swayed me to this camera. I have not had a chance to get out much with it, but the photos i have taken have not let me down. Easy to use with auto settings, and a lot more.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14MP Digital Bridge Camera.
Item.Review: A decent camera that is quality for the price, I made a mistake with this product as my 6 year old Panasonic Lumix delivers better results but is a larger camera. For the price it is worth the money, what I expected from it falls far below my expectations from Fuji cameras of which I have owned several. On the plus side it is easy to use and a good camera if you are relatively new to digital cameras. It eats batteries so deffo buy quality re chargeable ones ~~

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It is a great package for the price. It was a Christmas present for my husand. We have never been a "picture taking" family before now, but since Christmas, we are taking pictures of everyone and everything! The clarity of the picture is awesome. Very pleased with product!!!!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera was a gift to my twelve year old daughter that I will use occasionally. The camera seems to work best in P mode. The shutter lag is a bit annoying after using DSLRS.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is almost perfect. Pictures are beautiful. The only thing I don't like about the camera is that the lense cap doesn't snap on easily, so I pretty much have given up on attaching it and the card is a little tough to get out of the camera. Yet, those small annoyances aside, it is an excellent buy! ...

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Photos
Cons: Lens cap falls Off!
I am a Realtor in Brooklyn NY specializes in apartment Rentals. When ever i post Ad's on the internet for a Vacant apartment i always have to use a clear Photo and that is what this Camera delivers quality picture and plus affordable Price i will recommend this camera!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a camera that had a higher quality than a point-and-shoot, but without the full expense of a DSLR. This camera is a good balance and I have been happy with its performance. I really like the panorama function on it - it is very easy to use and results in some great shots. The macro feature is comparable to some more expensive cameras. I have not put this camera through any rigorous or difficult shoots, but what I have done has turned out great.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I had the Fuji S2000 Model prior to this one. It's still a great camera, (I've used it all over the country and it's been banged around but keeps on working). I personally like that it runs on AA batteries so that you're not locked in to having to charge it if you're at a Theme park or location where you can't get to a plug in ... most everyone carries AA batteries and if they're rechargeable ... all the better! I upgraded from the 10.0 Megapixels to the 14.0 Megapixels. A lot of the same features with the main exception being the panarama shots. Truly amazing in my book ... wish I had the feature before! Still a great camera for the enthusiast who cannot afford to upgrade to the expensive DLSR cameras! I got mine on sale and it was a great deal!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this for my wife after she dropped and broke her compact. She really wanted a camera with a view finder. This camera offers the view finder, huge zoom, and better picture quality than her last camera. All for a price that matches most compacts.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pros I use this camra for home/ field inspections. When zoomed into the roof and upperfloors the details are clear and details that could not be seem with the naked eye are visible. With the 4G memory card I can take over a 1000 pictures. This is a good starter camra that take professional pictures.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Night Photos; Easy To Use; Great Zoom; Good in Low Light; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Nice Body Color; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality; Good Image Stabilization
I bought this camera and love it. I would recommend this camera for everyone. It takes great pictures and you can't beat the price.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Great Zoom
While it is not hard to start taking pictures right away the camera does has a learning curve that can be over come by a studious reading of the full manual and then taking some time to try out the various modes. It can be a point and shoot camera on one hand yet allow you to get more involved over time which could be an introduction to more advanced photography.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom, Panorama
Cons: Pictures can be a little bleached when there is too much light, but that's true for most cameras.
Last week I arrived in Atlanta for my grandson's 3rd Birthday without my camera. Even though I had bought a new Canon SD1300 IS on Black Friday, I was not happy with the picture quality. I decided I was going to get something with more features and hopefully better picture quality. I went there intending to buy a Nikon L120, but they were out of stock. The clerk recommended this camera. I read the reviews on-line and they were pretty impressive, so I decided to give it a shoot. I mainly use "SR Auto" which selects the best option for the best picture quality. The pictures are the best I've ever taken and don't get me started on the zoom. With every came ... ra I've ever had zoom=blurry. Not with this one. In fact I would say the best pictures are when you zoom. The Panorama options is way to cool! If you are a novice like me and you don't like this camera, then you're standards are just too high. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use, great zoom, good price
Cons: Not quite a "compact" camera
I purchased this camera for a trip overseas. I wanted something of good quality, with a large zoom, but nothing bulky. I LOVE this camera. I was in France, and was able to zoom in on the stone work on a lot of the buildings, without any blurry images. Easy to use, good quality pictures, for a good value.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Can't beat the price for this good a camera!
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality, price and Fuji name.
Cons: Nothing negative (pun) here.
Used quite a lot since we bought it. Fantastic! I think it would be hard to take a "bad" photo considering it's ease of use.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I bought this camera for a concert i was going to in July. The camera did pretty good at taking pictures there. The zoom is amazing. Zooming in all the way (18x) made it look like i was up close. Sometimes the pictures were blurry when they were dancing and it wouldnt let me change the settings it was stuck on flowers. The camera took better pictures with out the flash than with it. With the flash the pictures were very dark.
Bad part of the camera it is so big and i had to carry it around the whole time i was at the concert because i didnt have a camera bag it would fit in.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to use for any type of photographer.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use and clear photos.
Cons: Heavy and short battery life.
I bought this as an upgrade from my Kodak camera and i'm very pleased with this product. I would recommend this to anyone who wants good quality photos.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Easy to use. I'm still getting used to all the functions, but right out of the box, it takes great pictures. I started using the full auto, now I'm on scene selection. The zoom is fantastic. The digital zoom along with the optical zoom makes the moon look wondeful. This is exactly what I was looking for. Planning a trip soon. Expect it to shine in regular situations as well.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Easy To Use
Cons: Short Battery Life
We got this just in time for our vacation and the pictures came out great! After about 250 pictures, we needed new batteries but I think it might be because I turned my camera on and off so many times on vacation. It's easy to change the batteries and takes AA which are pretty easy to find anywhere.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Stabilization; Good in Low Light; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom; Nice Body Color; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use
I mainly use this camera for college photo shoot and whenever I'm hanging with friends and loves ones. There are many great things about this camera and two of the main reason I bought it is because its fast and very compact. I just point and shoot instead of having to change lenses all the time like on my Canon D30. Overall I really enjoyed this camera.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: The lens cap doesn't fit well and keeps coming off
This is an amazing camera. Just returned from vacation to Yellowstone, Grand Teton and Rocky Mountain National Parks. The pcitures of the landscape and wildlife were amazing! Even took a picture of an antelope from the car through a spotty windshled and the picture came out crystal clear with no spots showing. Anyone can use this camera! LOVE IT, LOVE IT!!!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm not an expert, but I wanted something a little more than a simple point and shoot. So far it has been a great camera. I has all the settings a DSR camera has (with its own limitations of course). The EVF and panoramic mode are my two favorite features

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: 1. Used forFamily photo's, church events 2. Camera is great, I like the fact that it's small and light. Love the video recording. 3.Too early to tell yet, but so far it's been a great little camera.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: this fuji camra is great as a bridge camra if u are used to the smaller digital camras u should have no problem operating this one the only thing is that it takes a little time to get used to. but after u have masterd it you wont have aney more problems. this camra takes exelent pictures ,and i love the macro feture,

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm so disappointed with this camera. I've owned Fuji camera's in the past and been very pleased with them...hence deciding on this one. I wanted it as a middle camera, (I own a pocket digital and an SLR), to take shots for blog pictures. Unfortunately, I found the images to be either blurred, or sometimes grainy. My little Canon IXUS 80IS takes better close up shots. I did give it a fair trial and took outdoor shots as well, which produced some nice quality pictures. But it just didn't work well inside, and close up. Which is what I bought it for. So I have had to return it to QVC.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I'm pretty techy and gadget friendly, but have struggled with this. I am sure it is a great camera , but not for me.
I spent ages trying to work out what to do and couldn't find a way to upload the pics to my laptop.
I think I need a point and shoot, so sadly going back.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I purchased this camera as the TSV and I have been very impressed with the quality of pictures that it provides. I have been looking to upgrade from my casio compact camera and I am glad that I chose this model. Super fast delivery and super good value with all the extras supplied
This won't give you the same pictures as a decent SLR.. But at half the price it will still give you some amazing pics.. If you are looking for a decent camera at a decent price then I would definitely recommend.. 5 stars!!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I got this when it was the TSV because I wanted a better camera than a normal compact. I took a picture of a Bearded Dragon in its vivarium though the glass front, even with the heat lamp and UV bulb bright behind the dragon the picture is crystal clear. It is easy to use and with practice the extra features can be learned improving the quality of pictures taken.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a replace a much earlier Finepix bridge camera that takes excellent photos but is fairly heavy and slow and doesn't have the 1080 video that I want. I'm happy enough with the quality of the S2950's still photos (hence 3 stars); however, the video is a considerable disappointment to me. Although visually it is fine, I really can't work out how the background noise on the video playback (both in the camera and when downloaded to my laptop) could have escaped the presenter's attention. My mobile phone's video playback doesn't have that level of noise and nor does our Canon SX210is. So, overall a disappointment, and returned to QVC.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is small compact and I would say ideal to take anywhere with you. I like some of the features on the camera but must admit I have found some of the photographs a bit on the granny side -although to be absolutely fair I have not as yet printed up any of my photos. Its on the LCD screen that I have found this granny effect. I am in two minds at the moment as to whether to keep this camera or send it back - I must admit that I have had better cameras - but for the money and with the accessories included, its a good buy for someone wanting to use it say for the occasional holiday snaps.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Fun to use; Great Zoom
Cons: NONE-PERFECT CAMERA
GREAT CAMERA FOR ALL NEEDS. JUST PURCHASED IT AND I AM HAVING A BALL WITH IT. EASY TO HANDLE PERFECT PICTURES. FROM FISHING TO CAR AND BIKE SHOWS WOW WHAT FUN!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Large Clear LCD; Nice Body Color; Great Zoom; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Easy To Use

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: AA batteries; Panoramic; size; Weight
Cons: Poor Image Quality; Focus quality; Low light
I bought this to have more options while backpacking (less weight with lens flexibility). My Cannon Rebel is just too heavy. Haven't got to do a backpacking trip, but overall am disappointed with the consistency of this camera. Some shots are good and some very poor. This camera does not handle low light well at all!! My Cannon Powershot A1100IS is far more reliable and consistently takes better shots in all lighting. The Fuji Finepix may still be good for the hiking, but not much else. I think I will stick with Cannon.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've used FinePix cameras before, but I decided to try out a "bridge" camera. This combines the ease of use of a point-and-shoot camera with a number of expanded options, so if I really *want* to, I can adjust shutter speed for low-lighting conditions, etc. Even with just the automatic features, it does a much better job of taking pictures without a flash in conditions that would end up being grainy with a number of other digital cameras. I found the macro-focus mode (with a minimum range of less than 1") to be very useful for taking close-up pictures of small subjects, such as gaming miniatures and insects. My only real issue has been to try to figure out the circumstances under which the camera chooses to disable the flash, but other than that the operation is pretty intuitive if you ... 've used other digital cameras, and most of the time I've gotten by without even bothering to read the manual. Nice design, great bargain. ... expand » « collapse

Item.Review: I purchased this camera back in February 2011, and having never been one to take photo,it turned out that I have a knack for it. I have taken clear photos of object nearly a quarter of a mile away during fires, and yet have taken some of the most beautiful portraits I have ever seen... well worth ever cent I spent on it. OH!! I dropped it on a cement floor and it bounced.... I nearly cried, but picked it up turned it on and it took pictures just like it never happened.

Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Good Image Quality; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom
Cons: No users manual; No complete maual online
I think this is probably a very good camera but not being an accomplished photographer, the fact that it is impossible to find a comprehensive users manual is a real problem. When I happen upon appropriate setting to the products I am photographing the settings are lost when I turn off the camera. I have taken to writing down what I can see of the settings, but lack of a user's manual is inexcusable.

Item.Review: Sent this camera back after being very disappointed, it did nothing that it was supposed to, even the features which were discussed on QVC it did not do... What a disappointment!

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera as a replacement for DV video camera and stills camera, but was very dissappointed. Still photos were ok but has other reviewers said they were grainny, my main use for the camera was to make videos of my children in school and as they grow up and to upload them on social sites but the camera was making the sounds which were been recorded on the video and very noticeable on the tv,spoke to Fuji they said possibly a camera fault so had to send it back and lost on P & P both ways.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I would like to say i loved the camera,i really put it to the test and found it easy to use and very nice to hold,i found the battery life and card capacity to be perfect for my needs.
The zoom was great,i loved the ability to use electronic view finder rather than LCD screen.I really tried my best to love this camera.
Sadly i came home from a day of shooting only to find the images were grainy in anything but bright sunlight,
i found the camera suffered from very noticable barreling too.....i also found even with duel image stabilation on or leaving the camera on a tripod or stable surface there was a slight bluring to the upper left of the images i took(not a soft focus an actual blur)and always the same place,this is probably just a slight flaw with the camera i rec ... ieved and i wouldn't use this as a reason not to try it yourself.
The video has zoom but you can't use it if you want sound.infact the sound without zoom is poor too,if you just want 720p video with no sound then this is great at recording video though.
Overall i wish so much the images i got were up to the standard i would expect but these failed to match the images i get from my compact camera that cost £70 less,this camera will get you in to places and give you options a compact wont but i have to return this sadly which is a real shame as i tried everything to keep it but just could not get results i found as good as my compact.
I would say though it's really worth trying this camera if you are looking for a bridge camera on a budget,this may be all you ever need.For me it didn't quite live up to what i was hoping for and i will probably have to spend £150 more to get what i really want but i will wait for QVC because they always do a great deal. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm sorry QVC I'm very disappointed with Fuji. This is a lovely camera I wanted to up grade from my other Fuji camera the finepix S5700 which I purchased from you and am really happy with but this camera was the same price and had a lot more features. I used the alkaline batteries but they only lasted an hour, I thought the batteries maybe faulty so I had to open and try the rechargeable batteries that were supplied but it was the same only lasted an hour. I'm sorry I can't do with dealing with charging batteries every day, so I will carry on using my old faithful camera, the other is on it's way back to you.

Item.Item: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A GOOD CAMERA FOR THE MONEY
Item.Review: I ORDERED THIS CAMERA AS IT SEEMED VERY GOOD VALUE WITH THE EXTRAS OFFERED. I HAVE BEEN LOOKING AT BRIDGE CAMERAS FOR A WHILE AND DECIDED TO GO FOR IT. I USED TO HAVE A CANON EOS SLR BUT CARRYING LOADS OF LENSES ROUND GOT A BIT OF A BIND HAVE BEEN USING A CASIO EXILIM ALSO BOUGHT FROM QVC AND AN EXCELLANT CAMERA WHICH I WOULD NOT CHANGE AT ALL. WHAT I LIKED ABOUT THIS CAMERA WAS THE ABILITY TO USE A PROPER VIEWFINDER IN SUNLIGHT AS QUITE OFTEN SCREENS CANNOT BE EASILY SEEN ALSO THERE ARE OTHER FEATURES WHICH ALLOW FOR USING THE MANUAL PROGRAM. HAVE NOT REALLY HAD TIME TO PUT IT THROUGH ITS PACES YET BUT A BONUS FOR ME WAS I TOOK SOME PHOTOS OF MY DOGS INDOORS AT NIGHT AND THE EYES WERE PERFECT NOT EASY WHEN USING FLASH THANKS TO QVC I NOW HAVE TWO GREAT CAMERAS
